climbs.name: Boys' Night Out
climbs.fa: Jeff Widen, Cameron Burns, Jeff Singer. Oct 2, 1994

content.description:
P1: Tricky small aiding for the first 30 feet through a roof into easier climbing and then some low/mid 5th class to anchor.

P2: Keep heading up same crack/chimney to shoulder and belay again.

P3: Long pitch and rope drag will get you.  Climb down and around a block to get to obvious crack.  Up crack then traverse left on edges/weak crack and into OW.  Cam mentions using a hook to help in the traverse but we didn't find it necessary.  Up the OW (your rope drag is probably nearly show stopping by now) and then a short face climb to a fantastic and seldom visited summit.

Descent: Rap to shoulder and then another double rope back to the ground.  We used 70m ropes.
content.protection: 2x 00-6, stoppers. A blue big bro was used but fell out and became as useless as blue big Bros are.
content.location: Walk up the drainage on the north side of the tower.  The endless scree hill suxs.
